oai_dc:dc.dc:description: General order issued by Assistant Adjutant General George William Brent condemning the army's wanton destruction of fences, houses, countrysides and other property. Brent describes such action as "unworthy the character of Confederate soldiers, injurious to the holy cause they defend, and are alike destructive of personal honor and military discipline."

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: General orders are published directives issued by a commander, binding upon all personnel under his command to affect policies or procedures unique to a unit's situation that are not addressed by normal service regulations. General orders have the force of law within the unit where they are issued.
